Method Detail

setSystem

public void setSystem(pmaSystem paramSystem)

clearSession

public void clearSession()
This will reset the session as if it were an anonymous login should be called when there is a &logout in the url The session object is NOT destroyed on logout. It will be cleaned up later when the session has timed-out

toString

public java.lang.String toString()

setObjectLock

public void setObjectLock(boolean bLock)
This is used to determine how many other objects have an interest in this session The session cleaner should check this flag before destroying sessions

addSessionObject

public boolean addSessionObject(java.lang.String szKey,
                                java.lang.Object obj)
Adds an object to this session object. This is used as a temporary storage area for dynamic data. The data will vanish when the session is cleaned.

Returns:
true if the object was successfully added. The hashtable is already synchronized which should take care of thread contention. Object names (szKey) must be unique

getSessionObject

public java.lang.Object getSessionObject(java.lang.String szKey)
Gets a named object from the temp storage area

Returns:
null if the object is not found The hashtable is already synchronized which should take care of thread contention.

getAllSessionObjects

public java.util.Hashtable getAllSessionObjects()

removeSessionObject

public boolean removeSessionObject(java.lang.String szKey)
Removes a named object from the temp storage area. Pass null to remove all objects from the session

Returns:
true if the object was successfully removed The hashtable is already synchronized which should take care of thread contention.

isLocked

public boolean isLocked()
Returns:
true if something has locked this session

isLoggedIn

public boolean isLoggedIn()
Returns:
true if the user is not anonymous

isSystemSession

public boolean isSystemSession()
Returns:
true if the current session is a system session. system sessions should not be clustered.

getFullSessionID

public java.lang.String getFullSessionID()
Should make it harder to crack the session ID without sniffing the packets. Use the login time for an element of randomness. Added Server starttime so that it will be unique across clusters :-)

Returns:
String representing the cookie value

getCookieString

public java.lang.String getCookieString(java.lang.String sPath,
                                        java.lang.String sDomain)
Gets the string to send the http client This session is used to access the entire server, hence Path=/

hasExpired

public boolean hasExpired(int iExpiryMinutes,
                          int iAnonymousExpiryMinutes)
Determines if this session has expired based on the last transaction time

Returns:
true if the session has expired, else false

hasExpired

public boolean hasExpired(int iExpiryMinutes)
For backward compatibility. Treats anonymous sessions the same as logged in sessions.

public void setSessionTimeOut(int iNewTimeOut)
